div.p: The classification is phenotypical rather than genotypical, i.e. it does not provide codes for medical or scientific purposes.
National Code 'Not Known' means that the sex of a PERSON has not been recorded
National Code 'Not Specified' means indeterminate, i.e. unable to be classified as either male or female.

Note: This was e-GIF approved for use in NHS England. e-GIF and the Government Data Standards Catalogue
have been archived and are available for reference only.

p.b: PERSON GENDER CODE will be replaced with PERSON STATED GENDER CODE or PERSON PHENOTYPIC SEX CLASSIFICATION, which is the most recent approved national information standard to describe the required definition.
